content.description:
Start the same as for Zorro, but instead of traversing out on the jugs to the right, reach directly up to a good right hand and a small crimp for the left, get your feet high and lunge for the slopers up high. Establish your self on the slopers and continue to slap up a series of them eventually reaching a jug two feet back from the lip. 

  This could be a super condition dependent climb, may be easier in colder weather. but the feet are small and high and the committing-ness of the line is full value.
Another fun warmup in the Island. Start low on jugs and climb up to a ledge and good edges, then right to top out with the short crack.
content.protection: A pad, place it below the topout crack or have a spotter to move it.
content.location: In the complex of boulders right of Facelift and in front of the huge Helen Lieback/Grove Street boulder, this is on the rightmost boulder and climbs through the ledge and crack.

content.description: Start on the two obvious crimps with your left foot on the nice grainy edge between the two black streaks.  Make a hard move with your left hand swap feet and bring your left foot up to a dime edge.  Really nice crimping!
content.location: The first problem on the next boulder just right of Facelift.

content.description: Small crimps and get your feet high.
content.location: Face between large ledge and flake

climbs.name: My Body Is Not Designed For This

content.description: Start low with a good right hand flat edge and tiny left hand side pull crimp, find better crimps up and left. Find a way to get a foot onto the start hold and stand up to reach the top of the Helen Lieback crack.

Squat start at the incut rail is standard - climb out and right on good edges, signature toss to a sloper and an easy finish. Has also been done from a sit start on compression crimps making it a touch harder.
content.location: From facelift, cross the road. This boulder problem looks small from the road but is awesome when you get underneath it.

content.description: Obvious and fun lieback hand crack. Short and Sweet.
content.location: Located near the parking lot in The Island boulder field. On the boulder behind Zorro.

content.description: Climb into the detached fang and head straight up to good holds (better) or cut left (also good.)
content.protection: A pad and a spotter, there is a small boulder in the landing.
content.location: On the arete right of Facelift in the Island.

content.description: Super cool problem! Start low and climb the face with techy reaches on nice edges and slopers.
content.location: In the Island on the same boulder as Charlie's Angels and The Fang, climbs the left part of the obvious face. Descend off the back.

content.description:
Awesome extension into the classic Facelift. Start on Cable Route start holds and traverse across the face to the right, smearing, matching crimps etc get you over to the start of facelift, do facelift and feel like you just did a rock climbing route! 

  Originally this was graded easier, but along time ago someone broke off a good jug hold that made traversing over easier, now you match on a sloping crimp and sloper hole in the middle of the traverse.
content.location: Start on Cable Route traverse right into Facelift

content.description:
The Crucible is the beautiful tall face just left of Helens Lieback V0. People originally started the line by jumping or walking up the tree to start on the jug (the business is up high). A full standing start can be done and adds a v3-4 move into the mix to gain the starting jug. 

  Watch the rock behind you.
content.protection: Pads and big spotters, pad the big rock behind the route.

content.description: Squeezed, but worthwhile. Start just left of Facelift and follow the faint arete straight up, without using the jugs to the left.
content.location: On the Facelift boulder just left of Facelift, climb the faint arete without the jugs out left.

content.description: Start on the left side of the Facelift boulder, pull on to good edges and press out the easy and fun mantel on the jug.
content.location: On the Facelift boulder in the Island, left of Charlie's Angels.

content.description: A cluster of great boulder problems by the dirt parking lot on the left (the one with the toilets).
